titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for Dausie W. Trammell papers 1917-1919 and undated.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Polly Reynolds

publicationstmt.publisher: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created by Polly Reynolds 2007-05
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English.

titlepage.publisher:
Michigan Historical Collections
Bentley Historical Library
University of Michigan
titlepage.titleproper:
Finding Aid for
Dausie W. Trammell papers, 1915-1934.
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Polly Reynolds

did.abstract: Papers of a soldier in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition."

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Chris Pennington, of Corbin, Kentucky, in 2007 (Donor no.: 9876).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, Dausie W. Trammell papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Resident of Clio, Kentucky served as a Private, Company A., 339th Infantry during the American intervention in North Russia, 1918-1920. Trammell was killed in action in Maximovskaya, Russia March 3, 1919.

scopecontent.p: Trammell's collection consists primarily of photocopies of records from the National Archives documenting the search and retrieval of Trammell's body from Russia. Also, photocopies of photographs of Trammell and his grave.
